tree.content:
My name is ~~Inigo Montoya~~ Wolfram and I am a multi disciplinary web developer and experience designer. My specialty is in front-end development and designing new or uncommon interactions. In my spare time, I like to theorycraft, take things apart, and sometimes put them back together.

I am currently freelancing. You can find me in ~~NYC~~ ~~Atlanta~~ Chicago.

A design bootcamp located in Chicago that specializes in UI/UX education. Wrote front-end and back-end code with HTML, CSS, JS, on the LAMP stack. Debugged and optimized existing codebase as well as other developers' code.

Also acted as a dev and UX mentor for students, responsible for running workshops and assisting with design tasks.

Initiative that focuses on pairing grade school students with learning opportunities that help develop their interests. Worked with the designers at Adjust Creative to refine the designs and eventually code the pages. Worked on the front-end portion with Foundation and JS.
A community events calendar for all things design in the Chicagoland area, created for AIGA and DESIGNATION. Designed by Molly Lester. Coded as a Wordpress theme.
E-commerce site to buy local products from small and artisan stores. Created an HTML Prototype based off designs by Michael Yom and Adrian Aras. Eventually ported to Shopify.
Site is [viewable](http://piecesofthere.com) but no longer active.
Marketing page for a startup creating a brand new way for people to take care of their skin. Designed by JJ Lee.
Self-initiated project: music visualizer built with PaperJS. Allows the user to upload his or her own .mp3 files as well.
SAIC | Service design project for SAIC's Continuing Studies program. Conducted user and alumni research, created personas and drew up storyboards.

Erasing the Distance | Service design project for a NPO. Project was primarily focused on making internal financial processes more efficient. Conducted employee and management interviews to create a "plug-and-play" pricing calculator.
Campfires.io | Design blog that publishes weekly interviews with notable people in the design world. Sourced, edited, and published the blog copy and media.
